equipped.name: (a dragon hairpiece made of carved ivory and jade)

mobs.long_desc: The gatekeeper shakes his head in irritation and asks for your papers again.
mobs.desc: He is short, and a bit pudgy, with golden skin and dark, sharp eyes. His glossy black hair is cut in a strange way, upswept into a sort of ponytail. He generally appears agitated, and his movements are jerky and harried.

mobs.long_desc: A wall guard holds his pike and glares at strangers.
mobs.desc: He's shorter than the average human man, slender, and compactly muscled under his clothes and armor. His sharp eyes sweep the area around him with a detached, almost bored air, though he holds himself constantly ready for trouble.

mobs.long_desc: The Chajin bows before you, offering you tea.
mobs.desc: He is very old, with short, silvery hair crowning his golden-skinned head. His narrow eyes appear almost closed, they squint so badly, but they do not appear to miss much at all. He hunches over slightly and moves slowly, but he is quite muscular and wiry.

mobs.long_desc: The stately courtesan frowns at your callous invasion of her offices.
mobs.desc: She is an older woman, with silvery strands running through her otherwise inky-black, long hair. Her dark eyes are clear and intelligent, piercing whatever they rest upon. Her body is well-made and well-kept, and she moves with a sinuous grace. The woman's hands are particularly attractive, with carefully tended, buffed fingernails.

mobs.long_desc: The goddess screams in terror at your entrance.
mobs.desc: She is tall, with long, glossy black hair that hangs in tangles to her waist. Her body, barely covered in the rags of her formerly gem- crusted gown, reveals welts and bruises, and her blood-streaked hands and slim arms reveal her efforts to escape. Her fear-maddened screams echo through the room.

mobs.keywords: hunched-wizard yajiro hunched wizard cackles tim
mobs.long_desc: A hunched wizard cackles with glee at your daring.
mobs.desc: This old man is hunched over, shuffling everywhere he goes. His wild eyes look quite insane, but nonetheless shrewdly examine the world around him. His bony hands and large knuckles give him a skeletal appearance that is not offset by his wrinkled face and long nose.

mobs.keywords: sea-serpent form sea serpent green monstrous
mobs.long_desc: A monstrous green form rises out of the depths with a massive roar.
mobs.desc: It is a huge snakelike creature with glistening, light green scales that glitter like gems in the light. Its dinner-plate-sized eyes are very dark and very aware. It's easily the size of a ship in diameter, easily large enough to swallow people whole, though those fangs in its colossal mouth are surely signs that there's some biting involved.

mobs.long_desc: A stately lord glances at you calmly, then mentally dismisses you.
mobs.desc: He is every inch a nobleman, from his vacant, serene expression to his elegant clothes, stitched in red embroidery. His golden skin is perfectly kept, and his eyes don't seem to reflect any care in the world. Taller than most of his citizens, he remains aloof and untouchable.

mobs.long_desc: A piece of paper folds itself into a deer and advances upon you!
mobs.desc: A huge sheet of crisp, pure white paper begins to fold itself, quickly and intricately, until it has a recognizable shape -- that of a graceful white deer with many-pronged antlers. It folds and unfolds even while moving.

mobs.long_desc: A piece of paper folds itself into a tiger and springs upon you!
mobs.desc: A sheet of crisp, pure white paper folds and refolds itself until it has a recognizable shape -- that of a sinuous tiger, with crease marks for stripes. The creature pads forth gracefully, flicking its tail, but the paper is in a state of continual folding and unfolding, even as it moves.

mobs.long_desc: A piece of paper folds itself into a crane and shakes its wings.
mobs.desc: A huge sheet of crisp, pure white paper folds and refolds itself until it has a recognizable shape -- that of a long-legged crane with a huge wingspan. The creature's head even boasts fluffy-looking feathers and a very sharp-looking beak, and the wings beat the air as it moves.  The paper continually folds and unfolds around it as it moves.

mobs.keywords: demon oni ogre smoke pillar wizards-oni
mobs.long_desc: A swirling pillar of smoke coalesces into a demon and attacks you!
mobs.desc: Towering above most people, this creature's horns sweep the stone ceiling sometimes. Sometimes it looks black, sometimes red, sometimes the color of dried blood, sometimes the color of a scar. It smells like blood and fear, and it has a very fierce roar, which it uses quite often. Its hands end in vicious claws and seem quite strong.

mobs.long_desc: A monkey chatters and leaps around here.
mobs.desc: A small, four-legged mammal with short, dark, bristly fur and a very long tail bounces around nervously. It looks vaguely human, with big, bright brown eyes and little feet with opposable thumbs. Its movements are quite twitchy, and it bares its teeth in a sort of hissing motion.

mobs.keywords: sun-bird sunbird sun bird golden rising
mobs.long_desc: A beautiful bird with golden wings rises up in front of you.
mobs.desc: A huge, noble bird stands here as if guarding something. Its feathers are a brilliant, blinding golden color, with undulating stripes of red at the edges, and occasional ripples of blue passing through them. Its eyes are large and reddish-brown, and seem almost intelligent.

mobs.long_desc: A plumed courtier sniffs disdainfully at strangers.
mobs.desc: A simpering man with a white-painted face, this fellow is dressed in silken robes and wooden sandals. He walks with a mincing gait and his hands are always in motion illustrating some point or another.

mobs.keywords: girl robed robed-girl princess beautiful-girl beautiful
mobs.long_desc: A beautiful girl in an ornately embroidered robe looks around furtively.
mobs.desc: You strain to catch a better glimpse of this beautiful girl. She must be royalty. Her features, as delicate as porcelain and as sweet as smoke, are nearly hidden behind a gossamer white silken veil. Her long black hair hangs below her waist, unfettered. And her long robes, embroidered with fantastic shapes in golden thread, can't hide the beauty of her graceful form. She looks around as she walks, clearly nervous.

mobs.long_desc: A handsome youth in an embroidered robe looks around furtively.
mobs.desc: You couldn't hope to see a more attractive young man. The youth is tall, his shoulders broad. He walks with the arrogance of the young, not concerned with who might see him and be offended at his air of impudence. In fact, if the blades at his side are any indication, he wouldn't mind demonstrating his prowess with the sword with anyone who might object to him. He has the air of a man deeply in love -- incredibly happy.

mobs.long_desc: A young man folding paper grins up at you, daring you to cross him.
mobs.desc: This young man seems to have an awful lot of squares of paper handy. His golden skin is a little pale, as if he doesn't see a lot of sunshine, and his dark, slanted eyes seem a bit strained. His dextrous hands, though, handle paper as if he were born to it.

mobs.keywords: snake-princess snake princess sinuous girl sinuous-girl
mobs.long_desc: A beautiful, sinuous girl moves toward you gracefully.
mobs.desc: She moves quickly, yet languidly, as though her entire body were some marvelous, oiled spring. Her robes are green, and embroidered with golden scales. She smiles a deadly smile at you, hisses, and turns away as though you are beneath her notice.

mobs.long_desc: The kimono seller smiles at you while you wade through racks of silk.
mobs.desc: He is an older fellow, with wispy dark hair and an almost toothless smile, which he displays often. His voice, though babbling in a foreign language, is soft and gentle, and his hands, though gnarled, seem quite dextrous.

mobs.long_desc: A man measuring rice into bags smiles up at you.
mobs.desc: He is older, just a bit overweight, and smiles frequently, showing a mouth full of even white teeth that contrast with his faded tan skin. He talks very quickly, and his accent is even harder to place than those of most natives of the island. He moves slowly, though, grunting with pain with every movement.

mobs.long_desc: A wizened old man covered in wet clay smiles up at you from his turnwheel.
mobs.desc: He is an old man, bent over and hunched. He seems very serious and gentle. He's covered in clay, from eyebrows to feet -- yellow clay, red clay, and blue clay. The clay almost completely obscures his wrinkled, yellowish skin.

mobs.keywords: swordmaker sword maker sword-maker glaring man
mobs.long_desc: A powerful man steps away from his fiery pit to get a better look at you.
mobs.desc: As the smoke in the shop clears, you strain to see anything in the darkness. Slowly, the massive figure of a huge man comes to your tearing eyes. Sweat-covered, his muscles bulging, clad in a plain loincloth, he certainly doesn't seem like your idea of the wealthiest, most influential citizen of the city. But he is, and a more powerful fighter than anyone else in the market.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful, somewhat jaded young woman sings softly here.
mobs.desc: This tall, slim young woman has a clean, attractive face dominated by dark, alluring, eyes.  She wears abundant makeup, though it is expertly applied. Her long, glossy black hair hangs loose down her narrow shoulders.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful woman moves quickly through here, furtively eyeing her surroundings.
mobs.desc: She looks like a courtesan with her long black hair and almond-shaped eyes, but her behavior is very unlike that of the subtle, passive ladies she emulates. Quick, agile, and thoroughly brutal, once she is fighting, it's clear that her emphasis is not on charm and wit.

mobs.long_desc: A farmer draws his plow along a furrow.
mobs.desc: He's short and stocky, with muscles developed over years of use. He doesn't seem to display the least bit of interest in the world around him. Instead, he generally plods to wherever it is he's going. He's of middle age, with tan skin and dark, tired eyes.

mobs.long_desc: An ox plods slowly past you.
mobs.desc: It is a large, four-footed bovine mammal, with huge, sharp horns protruding from its head. Its large brown eyes hold no trace of intelligence, though they are gentle. Its coat of short greyish hair darkens near its four hooves.

mobs.long_desc: A woman with brilliant red hair and sharp canines cocks her head as she listens.
mobs.desc: She has golden skin, but amazingly red hair. She moves incredibly quickly, but here and there a glimpse may be caught of her sharp little white teeth. Her rust-colored robes complement her coloring well, but, oddly, she has no feet below the robe.

mobs.long_desc: A man with a white-painted face stares icily at strangers.
mobs.desc: The Emperor of Odaishyozen keeps a rather large contingent of samurai at his disposal. This man is one of them. His face painted a fashionable white with lead paint, and his hair pulled back into a topknot, he is not really an imposing figure. But those two swords at his belt are convincing enough proof of his prowess in battle. His bulky robes don't seem to detract from his speed.

mobs.long_desc: The samurai master chuckles at your bravery.
mobs.desc: The samurai master is old, yes, but clearly still in control of his faculties. His body is in the very peak of shape. His robes are elaborately embroidered with dragonflies, covering his beautiful body armor. He doesn't seem to be taking you seriously, even as he's fighting.

mobs.long_desc: The round-bellied merchant chuckles merrily at you.
mobs.desc: He's short and stocky, with muscles developed over years of use. He doesn't seem to display the least bit of interest in the world around him. Instead, he generally plods to wherever it is he's going. He's of middle age, with tan skin and dark, tired eyes.

mobs.long_desc: A furtive figure blends perfectly with the shadows here.
mobs.desc: It might be a man, but then, it could be a shadow, it moves so quickly and is so difficult to hit. All that can be seen of the person under the black costume is a strip of face and a pair of black furtive eyes.

mobs.long_desc: One of the Emperor's Honor Guard is totally ignoring you.
mobs.desc: He is taller than average, with golden skin and inscrutible eyes. Every movement he makes is carefully calculated and efficient, and the muscles he has developed over years of work ripple flawlessly. He has an impassive stare that takes in everything with lazy but very perceptive glances. Nothing really fazes him much.

mobs.long_desc: A townsman stares openly at strangers.
mobs.desc: He is a man from this area.  He's a bit short and overweight, dressed in a clean but drab linen smock and pants. A round straw hat protects his head from the elements. He tends to walk with a hurried pace, and generally avoids strangers even if he does tend to stare at them. His skin is golden, his eyes thin and weary.

mobs.long_desc: A townswoman avoids your gaze.
mobs.desc: She is small, with tanned skin and scrutinizing eyes that seem terribly suspicious and intelligent. Her long, black hair is bound up at the back, and she wears fairly new clothes of drab, undyed linen cloth.

mobs.long_desc: A fin projects from the water here, slicing toward you with uncanny ease.
mobs.desc: It's an immense fishlike creature, light grey in color, with a huge mouth full of rows of pointed teeth. It thrashes its tail to move, and it does move very quickly and efficiently.

mobs.long_desc: One of the Emperor's Honor Guard is totally ignoring you.
mobs.desc: He is taller than average, with golden skin and inscrutible eyes. Every movement he makes is carefully calculated and efficient, and the muscles he has developed over years of work ripple flawlessly. He has an impassive stare that takes in everything with lazy but very perceptive glances. Nothing really fazes him much.

mobs.keywords: Grand courtesan resplendent oiran woman Hinazuru
mobs.long_desc: A resplendent courtesan gazes dreamily out a window.
mobs.desc: Standing before you is the highest ranking courtesan in the Akusho pleasure house, the grand oiran Hinazuru.  Her elegance and composure are awe-inspiring, every glance from her jeweled eyes stunning.  A slight smile from her is enough to stop anyone dead in their tracks.  Her hair is extensively coiffed with bone and resin pins as befitting her station.  She wears a lavish silk kimono decorated with images of autumn and the crane motif of her namesake.  A single, slender delicate hand peeks out from the sleeve, gently holding a long pipe.

mobs.long_desc: An unfinished mob stands here.
mobs.desc: It looks unfinished.

mobs.long_desc: A wizened fishmonger guts fish here.
mobs.desc: He's shorter than even the usual islander, and his brown skin is golden but leathery. Bald and squinting, he presents a wizened appearance. His clothes are nothing short of primitive, with his ancient smock wrapped and tied around his waist and his trousers being baggy, equally ancient, and a bit too short. His feet are stuffed into cloth shoes. He reeks of fish, but seems friendly enough to the locals. He's very suspicious of foreigners, though.

objects.ground: A long foreign blade with a graceful curve has been shamefully abandoned here.

extras.text: It is a long, single-bladed sword that has a slightly curved blade and a short, octagonal crossguard.  The blade has a wavy, rippled coloration along its insanely sharp edge.  Its hilt is enamelled black wood wrapped with black silk cord.

objects.ground: A ceramic bottle has somehow not tipped over.

extras.text: The bottle is white ceramic, painted with blue symbols and pictures you can't read or identify. It looks like it could hold a lot of liquid.

objects.ground: A sword amazingly made of paper rests on the ground here.

extras.text: How can this be?  You can feel that this entire sword is made of paper, yet somehow it's hard as steel, and somehow it has an edge that cuts your finger when you test it!

objects.ground: A plain clay tea bowl has fallen to the ground here.

extras.text: The plain, light brown clay of the bowl is finely worked, but unornamented. You can see fine worksmanship in it, but you can't imagine why anyone would want one of these.

objects.ground: A striking jade necklace has been left here.

extras.text: The necklace is made of several very large, flawless panels of jade.  You run your fingers over the smooth stone and can feel supernatural power contained inside this rare piece of art.

objects.ground: A tea whisk has somehow fallen to the ground here.

extras.text: The whisk is only as large as a woman's hand, and made of bamboo.  Several pieces of light bamboo have been woven together at the handle, their ends allowed to fray to form a whisk.  It's lightweight, and its whorled strands of bamboo would make it an excellent whisk for the powdered tea of the tea ceremony of Odaishyozen.

objects.ground: You see a neatly folded length of black cloth.

extras.text: This is a very simple length of black cloth, hemmed all around very neatly. There's literally nothing impressive about it.

objects.ground: A glowing book with golden pages lies open here.

extras.text: The book almost hums with power.  You approach it reverently, ready to see the face of some god in its pages, but then...  Then...  You feel its sheer evil nature and realize this is not a text to praise a god, but entrap one!

objects.ground: A golden key exquisitely carved with phoenixes lies here.

extras.text: The gold of this key has been cunningly worked with figures of majestic birds. You wish you could actually see what inspired it!

objects.ground: One of the courtesans dropped her kimono here.

extras.text: As you whirl this beautiful silk kimono through the air, you are struck by how light, airy, and altogether good-looking this garment is.  You've heard that this gown has magical powers that turn its wearer beautiful, even irresistable. Maybe you should wear it and see?

objects.ground: A black lacquered war-fan lies open here.

extras.text: The fan looks much more threatening than your run-of-the-mill fan!  For starters, its rods are made of black-lacquered wood.  Instead of finely painted rice paper over the rods, you see thick white cloth, with a golden ball painted on both sides.  It could hang folded from your hand, and then, with a flick of your wrist, it could extend, becoming quite a parrying device.

objects.ground: An ornamental horned helmet lies on its side here.

extras.text: The helmet is made of gold-plated steel, but it's very light. A pair of thin, flat horns protrudes from the very middle of the helmet's front.

objects.short: a cuirass made of bamboo strips
objects.ground: You see a cuirass made, amazingly, of bamboo strips.

extras.text: This armor is so light that you wonder that it could be at all effective! Made from strips of bamboo cleverly lashed together with wire, it covers from the throat to the knees.  It looks like it ties in the back.

objects.ground: A bracelet made of one piece of pearl has been dropped here.

extras.text: It is a fine bracelet that looks like it was carved from one large pearl, with a twisting whorled design inlaid with gold.  It fits over the wrist, sliding on without a clasp or hinge.  It glows with the lustrous inner light that only the finest pearls have.

objects.ground: A long, beribboned spear stands against a wall.

extras.text: The naginata (for that is what you heard this long spearlike scythe was once called) is sharp-bladed and looks pretty nasty, but for all its ungainly size, you can feel how quick a weapon it is.

objects.ground: A wooden lute stands against one wall.
objects.action_desc: The plucked arrangement is strange and complex.

extras.text: The lute is seven-stringed, with a larger belly than you might expect of such a light-sounding instrument. It is undecorated.

objects.ground: An exquisite pearl ring has somehow been lost here.

extras.text: The main body of this exquisite ring is made of bright silver that seems to glow aquamarine-blue with an inner light.  The pearl that adorns it is stunning and larger than usual, with deep blue sapphires running otter-swift around the main center of attention.  The ring is neither wide nor narrow, making it wearable by either men or women.

objects.ground: A ball of rice wrapped in dried seaweed has fallen off some vendor's cart here.

extras.text: For a plain ball of rice wrapped in seaweed, it certainly smells good.

objects.ground: A vicious-looking ivory dagger lies here.

extras.text: You see a plain cream-colored ivory dagger, very simply carved, with a leather-wrapped handle.  It has a good balance, but other than that, it's nothing spectacular.

objects.ground: A beautifully carved fountain bubbles here.

extras.text: Inscribed on the side it says "Artemis circa 1996".

objects.ground: A neatly folded light blue kimono is sitting here.

extras.text: Sleeves which fall only to the elbow mark this as a men's-style kimono, unlike the full-sleeved women's kimono.  This way, the wearer still has plenty of room to handle a weapon.  Made of fine silk, it is meant to be worn loosely to allow even greater freedom of movement.  Understated in its elegance, any warrior would wear this robe with pride.

objects.short: a dark blue kimono with dragonflies
objects.ground: A kimono embroidered with dragonflies has been abandoned here.

extras.text: So light it seems made out of cloud rather than fabric, the silk has been dyed a dark blue and covered with dragonfly embroidery.  Looking closer, it seems that the dark blue kimono is only the outermost of three layers - inside it are a light blue and white kimono.  No wonder it can be used as armor!
The dragonflies are swen on to the silk with a combination of silk and metallic thread.  Bodies of iridescent green and wings of silver are outlined in a simple black on the deep blue of the kimono.

objects.ground: A rust-colored kimono is here, gathering dust.

extras.text: A simple robe of orange silk, the kimono is so light and soft that it would surely feel heavenly against the skin.  With the long, draping sleeves that could be used to conceal any manner of things, this women's-style kimono is tied with a much larger sash than the men's-style kimono are.

objects.ground: A kimono patterned with colored leaves is lying here, neatly folded.

extras.text: Made of a raw, tan-colored silk that is much heavier than normal silk, the kimono is patterned with leaves of red, yellow, orange, and brown.  The leaves are embroidered on with silk thread, making them shine in the light.  The body of the kimono must have been made of raw silk so that the textures, both tactile and visual, would complement each other.  This robe is truly a work of art.

objects.ground: A black cotton kimono lies forgotten on the floor.

extras.text: Made of thin black cotton, this kimono blends in perfectly with the shadows of night.  Silk would provide a telltale sheen, though it would also be lighter, but the black-dyed cotton absorbs light rather than reflecting it.  It is utterly silent, not even giving the usual "whoosh" of fabric when moved.  The sleeves fall only to the elbows, providing plenty of room to swing a weapon.

objects.ground: A thick purple kimono with gold and silver embroidery is lying here.

extras.text: This kimono is heavier than it looks!  Upon closer inspection, you see that it is really made of not one but twelve separate layers, from a golden silk embroidered with red on the outermost to a plain white cotton underkimono on the lowest layer.  How do people move wearing this many layers of clothing? It is a good thing the kimono is made to a loose-fitting design, or else they wouldn't be able to.  Voluminous sleeves provide a hiding place for trinkets and small, useful items without all that fuss about pockets.  Just being seen in such a robe would surely elevate one's social status.

objects.ground: A brush-tipped calligraphy pen lies here.

extras.text: It is a beige-colored bamboo pen set with a brush tip that allows it to be used for fine calligraphy in the Odaishyozen style. The brush tip is made of soft black sable hair.

objects.ground: A black ironworked key lies here.

extras.text: This simple iron key is beautifully lacquered and cast into a pleasing shape.

objects.ground: A key carved of opal glints in the light.

extras.text: Somehow this key has been carved out of solid opal. It glitters with inner fire as you turn it this way and that.

objects.ground: A handful of smoked fish lies here.

extras.text: This hunk of dried, smoked fish is salty but tender enough to eat out of hand. It smells faintly of the sea, and is somewhat reddish-brown in color.

objects.ground: A key made of metal-hard black wood fell to the ground here.

extras.text: The wood of this key is black and steel-hard. You try to break it, and can't. You wonder what it opens.

objects.ground: A simple metal key lies forgotten here.

extras.text: This key is nothing special. It's plain, nondescript metal, completely undecorated. It's almost rusted, in fact. You almost toss it aside, but as you do, you hear a faint whisper, a woman's soft voice, pleading...

objects.ground: A pair of samurai boots lay on the floor here.
Some samurai greaves lay on the chair here.
A pair of samurai gloves lay on the table here.
A samurai wrist guard is laying on the table here.
A pair of samurai armguards sit upon the table here.
A weird type of sash or belt lays on the table here.
A samurai chest plate sits on the ground here.
A piece of neck armor lays discarded on the floor.
A strange looking face mask is sitting on the ground here.
A discarded Samurai helmet sits on the ground here.
A sheathed katana sits upon a ceremonial stand.

triggers.name: odai_kannon_receive
triggers.commands: * I'm going to restructure this one ever so * Slightly to purge Kannon after she bolts so * She's just not hanging out in the void. * * Adding in a gem/gear loop as well. * if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %object.vnum% == 58200 wait 1 mjunk key mecho %self.name% stares in astonishment. say You... you're ... releasing me? mecho %self.name% looks around the cage, slowly regaining her composure. wait 1 say Please, accept these tokens! * boss setup - trigger 55586 * set count 0 while %count% < 3 set bonus %random.100% set will_drop %random.100% * 4 pieces of armor per sub_phase in phase_2 set what_armor_drop %random.4% * 11 classes questing in phase_2 set what_gem_drop %random.11% * if %will_drop% <= 60 * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 50 * drop a gem from the previous wear pos set eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55637 mload obj %gem_vnum% elseif (%bonus% >= 51 &%bonus% <= 90) * We're in the Normal drops from current wear pos set * drop a gem from the current wear pos set eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55648 mload obj %gem_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop a gem from the next wear pos set eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55659 mload obj %gem_vnum% endif elseif (%will_drop% >=61 &%will_drop% <= 80) * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 50 * drop destroyed armor 55299 is the vnum before the * first piece of armor. eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55343 mload obj %armor_vnum% elseif (%bonus% >= 51 &%bonus% <= 90) * We're in the Normal drops from current wear pos set * drop armor from the current wear pos set eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55347 mload obj %armor_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop a piece of armor from next wear pos eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55351 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif else * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 50 * drop armor and gem from previous wear pos eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55637 eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55343 mload obj %gem_vnum% mload obj %armor_vnum% elseif (%bonus% >= 51 &%bonus% <= 90) * We're in the Normal drops from current wear pos set * drop a gem and armor from the current wear pos set eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55347 mload obj %armor_vnum% eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55648 mload obj %gem_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop armor and gem from next wear pos eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55659 mload obj %gem_vnum% eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55351 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif endif eval count %count% + 1 done remove all.pearl give all %actor.name% wait 1 say I'm FREE! mecho The goddess disappears in a flash of blazing light! mpurge kannon endif endif

triggers.name: charm_person_hinazuru_greet
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[charm_person]% wait 2 switch %stage% case 1 say I see you have returned. bow %actor.name% wait 1s say Have you found %get.obj_shortdesc[48008]%? break case 2 say Welcome back. bow %actor.name% wait 1s say I hope you have been able to observe the methods of the troupe and return with a trophy. break case 3 say I am delighted to see you again. bow %actor.name% wait 1s say How is your search for the instruments coming along?  I truly look forward to hearing your tales. break case 4 mecho %self.name% says, 'Welcome back, I was not expecting to see you again so soon.  Are you having trouble locating your conversation partners?  I can update you on your &7&b[spell progress]&0 if you are.' break default say Welcome honored guest. bow wait 1s say I am delighted to host you. if (%actor.class% /= Sorcerer || %actor.class% /= Illusionist || %actor.class% /= Bard) && %actor.level% > 88 && %stage% == 0 wait 1s say You seem like you might be interested in some of my specialty services. endif done

triggers.name: charm_person_hinazuru_speech1
triggers.argument_list: specialty services yes like what? services? speciality?
triggers.commands: if (%actor.class% /= Sorcerer || %actor.class% /= Illusionist || %actor.class% /= Bard) if %actor.level% > 88 if %actor.quest_stage[charm_person]% == 0 wait 2 say I am not only a master of conversational and social arts, I am also highly trained in the mystic arts. Sorcerers and illusionists come from all across the world to learn my signature spell for charming others. wait 2s say If you are interested, I could teach you.  For a price.  100 platinum, at once, in advance, is my fee. elseif %actor.quest_stage[charm_person]% == 1 say Marvelous! wait 1s say If you would be so kind as to give it to me, I can demonstrate its power. endif else say Your determination is admirable, but I fear you still have some learning to do before I can teach you. endif endif

triggers.name: charm_person_hinazuru_pay
triggers.commands: if (%actor.class% /= Sorcerer || %actor.class% /= Illusionist || %actor.class% /= Bard) && %actor.level% > 88 && %actor.quest_stage[charm_person]% == 0 quest start charm_person %actor.name% bow %actor.name% say I give humble thanks for your payment. wait 2s say The first thing you will need is an implement which casts the spell you seek to learn so you may experiment with it. wait 2s say Only one such item exists in the world: a simple black metal rod buried in an extensive crypt in the Iron Hills. wait 2s say Please retrieve it and bring it back to me. bow %actor.name% wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'During this training, if you need to check your &7&b[spell progress]&0, you may ask at any time.' bow %actor.name% else say I am deeply honored by your gratuity. bow %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: charm_person_hinazuru_receive
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[charm_person]% if %stage% == 1 if %object.vnum% == 48008 quest advance charm_person %actor.name% wait 2 mjunk discipline wait 1s say Thank you kindly for bringing this so quickly. bow %actor.name% wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% gives you an explanation and demonstration of %get.obj_shortdesc[48008]%'s power and function. wait 3s say Having seen this magic in a controlled environment now, I believe it's best to see it in action. wait 2s say Many people underestimate the power of charms and enchantments.  They discard them as ineffective or weak compared to more violent magic. wait 4s say Yet there is a company of performers in Anduin that proves the most insidious spells do not harm people directly, but convince them to harm themselves. wait 4s say They perform a deadly song and dance number which results in the sacrifice of an unwitting accomplice.  They give out rings of fire to those who participated at the end of the show. wait 4s say Go and watch this in action.  Bring back the fire ring as a token of your experience. bow %actor.name% else return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. say This is not the Rod of Discipline. endif elseif %stage% == 2 if %object.vnum% == 4319 quest advance charm_person %actor.name% wait 2 mjunk ring wait 1s say Thank you kindly for bringing this so quickly. bow %actor.name% wait 2s say It's horrific what charms can make people do, isn't it? wait 1s shake wait 1s say Yet I am glad you have seen it now so you understand the risks involved in charming and beguiling. wait 3s say I also had you observe the theatre because you need to have at least a limited knowledge of music. wait 3s say As a courtesan, I am expected to be a master of several instruments, as well as song and dance.  As a magician, I use this same mastery as a key element in my spells. wait 2s say You will need to seek out musical instruments to hone your charming skills. wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'There are five instruments you must find: mecho - One is merely the &3&bbiwa&0 held by Yoshino down the hall&_ mecho - Two are &3&bflutes&0 hidden from the sun: mecho &0    One &3&bdeep in the sea to the east&0 mecho &0    The other &3&bin a mine near Anduin&0&_ mecho - One is a &3&bhand-fashioned reed pipe&0, popular with people far far to the west&_ mecho - The final is &3&ba mandolin&0, found in the homes of the gods' wait 4s say Once you have found all five of these, come back to me so I may check their condition and ensure their proper tuning. bow %actor.name% else return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. say This is not one of the souvenirs the theatre company gives out after a performance. endif elseif %stage% == 3 if %object.vnum% == 58017 || %object.vnum% == 16312 || %object.vnum% == 48925 || %object.vnum% == 37012 || %object.vnum% == 41119 if %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:%object.vnum%]% return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. say You have already brought me %object.shortdesc%. else quest variable charm_person %actor.name% %object.vnum% 1 wait 2 mecho %self.name% checks %object.shortdesc% for tuning and quality. wait 1s say Yes, this should do.  Now come sit, it is time for a lesson. wait 2s msend %actor.name% %self.name% begins to teach you several basic techniques and a few melodies. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% begins to teach %actor.name% several basic techniques and a few melodies. wait 5s msend %actor% You begin to get a feel for it... wait 7s msend %actor% After several hours, you seem to have picked up the basics! mechoaround %actor% After several hours, %actor.name% seems to have picked up the basics! give all %actor% say Hold on to that instrument, you'll need it later. wait 2 if %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:58017]% && %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:16312]% && %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:48925]% && %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:37012]% && %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:41119]% quest advance charm_person %actor.name% wait 4 say You now have at least a modicum of experience in five instruments.  It is time to put your skills to the test and see what you have learned! wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'There are five master charmers in the world.  Take these instruments out and see if you can impress them.  Each one prefers a different kind of music, so be ready to show off your skills! mecho &0 mecho &0- One runs the &5&bjewelry shop in Mielikki.&0 mecho &0- One is a local &5&bactor&0 here on the &5&bEmerald Island.&0 mecho &0- One works with the &5&bacting company in Anduin&0, playing their &5&bQueen.&0 mecho &0- One is a &5&bhideous creature that enslaves minds&0 in the dark &5&bdrow city.&0 mecho &0- The last can be any of the &5&briver nymphs&0 in the &5&bRealm of the King of Dreams.&0&_ mecho &0Say to them &5&b[Let me serenade you]&0 and see what they do.' wait 5s say It is here our paths must split. wait 1s say It has been my pleasure to work with you. wait 1s say Farewell. bow %actor.name% else eval music (%actor.quest_variable[charm_person:58017]% + %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:16312]% + %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:48925]% + %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:37012]% + %actor.quest_variable[charm_person:41119]%) if %music% > 0 && %music% < 4 say Do you have the other instruments? elseif %music% == 4 say Do you have the last instrument? endif endif endif else return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. say %object.shortdesc% is not a musical instrument. endif else return 0 Shake mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. say I am in need of nothing at the moment, thank you. endif

triggers.name: charm_person_serenade_speech
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[charm_person]% == 4 wait 2 switch %self.vnum% case 3010 say A little music sounds delightful.  I enjoy the gentle strum of a mandolin. break case 58017 say How unconventional!  Usually I'm the one doing the wooing.  I dearly love the willowy call of the flute. break case 4353 say Oh of course. lick wait 1s say What can I say, I'm a sucker for a hot, long pipe. grin break case 23721 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you telepathically, 'A very strange request.  The only surface-dwelling music I can tolerate is the lute.' break case 58406 say I would love to hear a tune!  Instruments that sound like the wind meeting the water are my favorite. break default return 0 done endif

rooms.name: Shoreline
rooms.description: A pure white beach skirts the blue waters of an ocean.  An ornamental red gate sticks up out of the water near the sand.  To the north, the island itself is shrouded in mists, but a green mountain can be seen stretching toward the sky.  A pebbled path begins here and heads north, toward a golden wall.

North.description: The path continues to the north here.

South.description: The inlet begins to the south.

rooms.name: Pebbled Path
rooms.description: The white shells crunch underfoot as you traverse this well-cared for path. Something huge and dazzling rises before you to the north, with hills behind it, rising like giant emeralds.  The grey volcano rises even higher, embracing the city and its green fields and hills -- an excellent natural defense against invaders.  This inlet and path seem to be the only way into the city.  A carved stone lantern stands here.

North.description: The beautiful golden gates of Odaishyozen rise before you to the north.

South.description: The shore is behind you to the south.

extras.text: You have to admire the stone lantern's graceful lines.  It stands like a sentinel, near this beautiful gate.  It is not lit, but you can see the wick inside it.  Presumably lighting it is one of the daily traditions of the local culture.

rooms.name: The Yomeimon Gate
rooms.description: The locals, some people might discover, call this place 'The Live-Long-Day Gate' for how long one might stand and stare at its splendor.  It's two stories tall, made of wood that's been gilded in beaten gold, and is just covered in carvings of dragons, lions, phoenixes, and ogres, as well as scenes from nature like steep, jagged cliffs and oceans.  A gilded pine tree dominates the gate's center.  Around the gate, huge walls stretch to the east and west, protectively encircling the city that lies beyond it.  The green hills past here tend to be mist-embraced, their color contrasting with the gold of the gate and the grey stone of the walls.

North.description: The sturdy gate is made of thick wood covered in pure gold, and is carved with fantastic beasts and nature scenes.  When it's open, fertile fields and shining roads can be seen, and past that, emerald hills covered in mist. An inscription is set on a golden plaque at the side of the gate, written in a strange script.

South.description: You can leave Odaishyozen to the south.

Up.description: You notice some stairs leading up, into darkness. Pictures line the walls, in a very precise line along the wall.

extras.text: It reads "Artemis, circa 1995."
They are the most intricately carved gates you've ever seen. You see an inscription near the bottom of the left-hand gate.

You can't imagine why a guard tower has pictures on its walls. Perhaps there is a religious significance to them--they do, after all, all seem to depict the same thing: Some kind of horrific sea-battle between a gigantic, colossal serpent and some puny war-boats.

rooms.name: The Upper Gate
rooms.description: The upper part of the gate is just as dazzling as the one below.  It's a stone platform with a red tile roof, and some narrow holes in it for archers to use.  Sunlight streams in past the archer's windows.  It has no walls; instead, it opens up directly into the wall, which stretches far to the east and west. From here, the entire city spreads out to the north, with its huge fields, green and multi-rowed, and its labyrinth of interconnected buildings. Two magnificent buildings dominate the view--palaces, perhaps.

East.description: To the east, the wall stretches forth.

West.description: You see the top of the gate going far to the west.

Down.description: The stairs go back down to the main gate.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: This is the top edge of a great stone wall that surrounds the city.  To the direct west is the upper gate that leads down to the lower level.  To the east, the wall stretches for quite some distance.  It can be walked along safely, thanks to hip-height restraining walls.  Below, fields and buildings extend to the north, while citizens go about their daily business.

East.description: The wall continues to the east.

West.description: The wall continues to the west.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: This is the top edge of a protective wall that encircles the city to the north. It's safe to traverse thanks to hip-height retaining walls on either side of it, all of it in the same light grey stone bricks. To the west not too far away, a golden gate allows passage to the ground level, while the wall stretches to the east some ways toward a pagoda. Cultivated fields can be seen to the north, along with a number of residences and businesses. Two huge buildings dominate the view from there, both possibly palaces.

East.description: The wall continues to the east.

West.description: The wall continues to the west.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: A grey stone wall stretches to the east and west some distance. It's clearly meant to be walked along, since it's both wide enough for the idea and safe enough thanks to retaining walls on either side of the walkway. Some distance to the west along the wall, a dazzling golden gate can be seen, and some distance to the east, the wall ends at a pagoda with a peaked red roof. Beyond this wall, on the ground, can be seen large cultivated fields and small structures built close together. A palace rises to the north, dominating the view.

East.description: The wall continues to the east.

West.description: The wall continues to the west.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: This strong stone wall is built wide enough for several people to walk across it together comfortably. It's safe thanks to the hip-height retaining walls built along its edges. From here, the view is impressive to most, with fields and palaces to the north and a beach to the south. A pagoda can be seen to the east not too far away.

East.description: The wall continues to the east here.

West.description: The wall continues to the west. The Yomeimon gate is far away.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: A large, grey stone wall stretches to the east and west.  To the north, the city is visible, with its fields and its buildings.  To the south, a glittering beach skirts the edge of a vast blue sea.  The wall itself is wide enough for several people to walk abreast along it.

East.description: The wall continues a short way to the east, ending at a tower.

West.description: The wall continues far to the west.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: This is the eastern end of a large, wide wall that stretches far to the west.  It's made of grey stone, and is wide enough for several soldiers to walk abreast on it.  A pagoda tower rises just to the east.  Narrow archers' windows reveal desks and bookshelves inside it.

East.description: A large, ornate door carved with phoenixes stands here.

West.description: The wall continues far to the west.

rooms.name: Guard's Offices
rooms.description: Narrow archers' windows line this round chamber.  Its wooden walls seem quite sturdy, enclosing desks and bookshelves.  A rack on the wall is empty, but clearly is intended for storing weapons. The room is quite neat and utilitarian, with no decorations on the walls and no rug on the wooden floor. Two doors lead to the north and west, both rather sturdy.

North.description: A door is set into the north wall. Its carved pattern of interleaving phoenixes almost hides its incredible strength and its reinforcing studs.

West.description: A door carved with phoenixes is set into the west wall.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: A short bit of wall abuts bare grey rock.  The side of the mountain itself, it rises the further north it goes until it joins with the green slopes of the main mountain in the island's center.  The village is visible inside the enclosure formed by the wall and the mountainside.  A pagoda stands to the immediate south.

South.description: A gilt door carved with phoenixes and dragons is set into the south wall of the tower.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: This grey stone wall extends to the east and west.  It's wide enough for several people to walk abreast it, and it's tall enough to afford a magnificent view of the city to the north, inside the wall, and the beach outside the wall. The blue waters form a pretty bay to beyond the white beach.  A staircase descends to the east, and a pagoda stands further along the wall.

East.description: The Yomeimon Gate lies directly to the east.

West.description: The wall continues far to the west.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: This wide, well-kept wall runs to the east and west from here.  The wall is tall enough to give an excellent view of the surrounding land, including the bay and beach to the south and the emerald fields of the village to the north. A palace rises far in the distance, and beyond it, a mountain looms over the entire island.  An ornamental red gate stands in the waters to the south.

East.description: The wall continues to the east, broken by the Yomeimon Gate.

West.description: The wall continues to the west a short distance, ending at the mountain's bare rocky side.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: This is the top of a wide, grey stone wall that runs to the east and west. It's tall enough to give a splendid view of the surrounding terrain, including the beach and bay to the south, and the town to the north, with its orderly rows of fields and small, tidy white buildings.

East.description: The wall stretches far to the east.

West.description: The wall continues a short distance to the west.

Down.description: Below you, the beach teems with life. You can see a fight going on between two animals, a large monkey of some sort, and an impressively large blue snake.

rooms.name: On the Wall
rooms.description: This is the western end of a tall, wide grey stone wall that stretches off to the east.  Rubble blocks the way to the west -- broken, jagged bits of grey stone that might have been bricks of the wall long ago.  A spur of rock extends off to the south, into the water, cradling a long channel to itself.  To the north, the city nestles inside the mountain's valley, right beneath its shadow.

East.description: The wall stretches far to the east.

West.description: You look west, to behold what must be the aftereffects of a mountainslide of some sort -- newly fallen rocks completely block safe passage to the west. The steep grey mountain's walls rise behind the tower; you can tell where the rocks must have come from. The city, to your north, sparkles in tones of green, alabaster, and gold.

rooms.name: A Rocky Beach
rooms.description: Pocked and jagged volcanic rocks rise from the ocean up to the outer walls of Odaishyozen, forming a small rocky beach.  The beach scatters westward from a small break in the imposing volcanic hills around the city.  It hugs the tall gray walls of the city which stand sentinel to the North, separating its inhabitants from the dangerous waters beyond.  The beach continues to the west.

rooms.name: A Rocky Beach
rooms.description: Pocked and jagged volcanic rocks rise from the ocean up to the outer walls of Odaishyozen, forming a small rocky beach.  The beach lies scattered across a small break in the imposing volcanic hills around the city.  It hugs the tall gray walls of the city which stand sentinel to the North, separating its inhabitants from the dangerous waters beyond.  The beach continues to the east and west.

rooms.name: A Rocky Beach
rooms.description: Pocked and jagged volcanic rocks rise from the ocean up to the outer walls of Odaishyozen, forming a small rocky beach.  The beach lies scattered across a small break in the imposing volcanic hills around the city.  It hugs the tall gray walls of the city which stand sentinel to the North, separating its inhabitants from the dangerous waters beyond.  The beach continues to the east and west.

rooms.name: A Rocky Beach
rooms.description: Pocked and jagged volcanic rocks rise from the ocean up to the outer walls of Odaishyozen, forming a small rocky beach.  The beach lies scattered across a small break in the imposing volcanic hills around the city.  It hugs the tall gray walls of the city which stand sentinel to the North, separating its inhabitants from the dangerous waters beyond.  The beach continues to the east and west.

rooms.name: A Rocky Beach
rooms.description: Pocked and jagged volcanic rocks rise from the ocean up to the outer walls of Odaishyozen, forming a small rocky beach.  The beach lies scattered across a small break in the imposing volcanic hills around the city.  It hugs the tall gray walls of the city which stand sentinel to the North, separating its inhabitants from the dangerous waters beyond.  The beach continues to the east and west.

rooms.name: A Rocky Beach
rooms.description: Pocked and jagged volcanic rocks rise from the ocean up to the outer walls of Odaishyozen, forming a small rocky beach.  The beach lies scattered across a small break in the imposing volcanic hills around the city.  The gray walls of Odaishyozen fade away in the distance, leaving this area fully surrounded by volcanic mountains.  Debris from landslides and erosion have filled the end of the beach with rocks and boulders of many sizes.  The ground shows signs of recent disturbances, like someone or something has moved through here recently. The beach is met by those rough cliffs on the west while extending back to the east.

North.description: Looking closer, one of the boulders seems to have been recently moved.

extras.text: It seems this boulder has been rolled into place to cleverly disguise a cave mouth of some kind.  Some kind of writing rings the boulder, demarcating the cave mouth.
The writing seems to tell the story of something called the "Iwa-no-to," a confusing story of a goddess, a boulder, a shaman, and a sacred mirror.

rooms.name: **UNUSED**
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: Arre Matu's Private Chambers
rooms.description: This is Arre Matu's private room in the Stone Temple.  It is sparsely decorated, a lone rug covers barely a quarter of the hard floor, and there is a long stool on which to meditate in one of the corners.  The room itself is oddly shaped, having the walls slope up to the ceiling rather than have the two meet at a right angle.  The east wall is flat, while those to the north, south and west seem to all curve together.  There is no exit in any direction.

rooms.name: A Small Stone Alcove
rooms.description: This room is small and carved into solid grey stone.  There are some small scratches in the otherwise smoothly carved walls.  There is a little wet spot on the stone ground, seeming to come from below somehow.  Distantly to the south is the Temple Altar, barely visible through the opening back that direction.

rooms.name: Sumisara Way
rooms.description: The Yomeimon Gate opens to reveal a wide, well-kept paved road that stretches all the way to the palace far to the north.  Between you and the palace, you see the rice fields, a bazaar of some kind, and houses of all descriptions, their red tile roofs curving to the skies like pointing fingers.

North.description: The street continues to the north. Far away, you see a palace.

East.description: Huge rice fields stretch to the east.

South.description: You can exit Odaishyozen by the gate south, if you were crazy enough to want to leave.

West.description: Green rice fields go off to the west.

rooms.name: Sumisara Way
rooms.description: A wide, well-kept paved road stretches from a dazzling golden gate to the south all the way to the huge palace far to the north. Along the road, lush green cultivated fields grow. The citizens here tend to be short, lithe, and golden-skinned, and don't act friendly toward strangers. The area is scrupulously clean and well-tended, with especially well-maintained buildings.

North.description: The street continues to the north.

East.description: Rice fields go off to the east.

South.description: The street continues to the south, ending at a golden gate.

West.description: Rice fields go off to the west.

rooms.name: Sumisara Way
rooms.description: A wide, well-kept paved road runs from north to south through what is clearly the agricultural center of a small village.  The houses of the villagers are visible to the north, far from the green fields to the east and west.  A large palace stands to the north, far away, while a small thatched building rises to the immediate east.

North.description: The street continues to the north.

East.description: Green fields go off to the east.

South.description: The street continues to the south, ending at a golden gate far away.

West.description: Green rice fields go off to the west.

rooms.name: Sumisara Way
rooms.description: The clean, paved road extends far to the north and south.  The lush rice fields seem pretty deep to the east and west.  Beyond them, laughter rises from the tall, roofless building to the west. To the east, a large statue rises up beyond a pale stone wall. What little of the building inside that wall can be seen looks like a temple with austere lines and a peaked roof. From here, rice fields grow to the east and west, while the road runs to the north toward a vast palace or to the south toward the dazzling golden Yomeimon Gate and the city walls.

North.description: Sumisara Way continues to the north, ending at another road.

East.description: Green rice fields go off to the east. Far away you see a building of some kind.

South.description: The street continues far to the south.

West.description: Green rice fields go off to the west. Far away you see a wooden fence.

rooms.name: Sumisara Way
rooms.description: The clean, paved road extends far to the north and south.  The lush rice fields seem pretty deep to the east and west. A tall hedge growing to the east bounds a statue and a thatched hut. To the west, a gilded building rises behind a fence of some sort past the rice fields.

North.description: The street continues to the north, ending at another road.

East.description: Rice fields go to the east a short distance, ending at some tall trees that encircle a building of some kind.

South.description: The street continues far to the south.

West.description: Green fields go to the west, ending at a tall wooden fence.

rooms.name: Sumisara Way
rooms.description: The clean, paved road extends to the north and south through rice fields that are green and nearly ripe. A hut stands to the east, not far away, but a much larger building stands far to the west, with laughter and the sound of voices coming from it. The road is very clean, leading north toward the city itself and south toward a beautiful golden gate some distance away. The exotic people who live here act very suspicious of strangers.

North.description: The street continues only a short distance to the north before it ends in a T-intersection.

East.description: Lush green fields go to the east, ending at tall shrubs.

South.description: The street continues for a long ways off.

West.description: You see a tiny corner of the rice fields, ending at a tall wooden fence. Laughter is coming from behind the fence.

rooms.name: Sumisara Way
rooms.description: The wide, paved road ends here, extending to the south some distance toward a gleaming golden gate far away. Rows of cultivated fields grow to the east and west, some attended by farmers with their plows and beasts. A walled temple rises to the east, its peaked roof visible from here, and not far to the north, the palace wall looms. Emerald-green hills rise around this valley city, their slopes cloaked in mist most of the time.

North.description: Another street runs perpendicular to this one. A noisy bazaar and a palace stand beyond this.

East.description: Beautiful green fields end at a peaceful-seeing pond.

South.description: Sumisara Way extends far to the south, ending -- you think -- at a golden gate.

West.description: You see beautiful, shining green fields to the west.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: The tall green rice plants don't quite hide the water flooding the field. In places the sun reflects off the water, glinting like diamonds among the lush green of the rice plants.  The croaking of frogs and the buzzing of dragonflies lulls your senses.  Here and there birds wheel across the sky, dipping low to catch insects from the water.  The people working in the fields glower at you, clearly wanting you to get out of their fields before you destroy the delicate plants.

North.description: The fields extend far to the north.

East.description: A paved run stands directly to the east.

West.description: The fields extend far to the west.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: The tall green rice plants don't quite hide the water flooding the field. In places the sun reflects off the water, glinting like diamonds among the lush green of the rice plants.  You can go east, west, or north from here.  The city wall bounds you to the south.  You can't climb this wall, and from the look of the guards patrolling it, you don't think you want to try.

North.description: The fields extend to the north, interrupted only by a bamboo hut.

East.description: The fields go a short way to the east, ending at a paved road.

West.description: The fields go a short way to the west, ending at the mountain's steeply rising face.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: Your eyes are dazzled by the sheer life you behold.  You can easily see why poems have been written about this sight.  The field ends here in a neatly-clipped corner, and continues to the north and east.  The wall abuts it here as well, to the south, but you can't climb it from here.

North.description: The fields go a short way to the north.

East.description: The fields go a ways to the east, ending at a road of some kind.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: The tall green rice plants don't quite hide the water flooding the field. In places the sun reflects off the water, glinting like diamonds among the lush green of the rice plants.  The croaking of frogs and the buzzing of dragonflies lulls your senses.  Here and there birds wheel across the sky, dipping low to catch insects from the water.  The people working in the fields glower at you, clearly wanting you to get out of their fields before you destroy the delicate plants.  The field goes on in all directions; the road bounds it on the east.

North.description: The fields continue far to the north.

East.description: You see a road, and beyond that, more fields.

South.description: Southward, the fields end at a tall stone wall.

West.description: The fields continue to the west.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: The fields glisten in the sunshine.  Your feet slip in the mud, and you wonder what's living down there - was that something alive that slid over your foot as you went?  You can't believe how alive, how FERTILE, this land is. Speaking of which, you can go north to the threshing hut, or east, west, or south to explore the fields further.

North.description: You see a curious bamboo hut to the north.

East.description: The fields continue a short way to the east before being interrupted by a road; beyond that, you see more fields.

South.description: South, the fields end at a tall stone wall.

West.description: The fields end to the west.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: The tall green rice plants don't quite hide the water flooding the field. In places the sun reflects off the water, glinting like diamonds among the lush green of the rice plants.  Here and there birds wheel across the sky, dipping low to catch insects from the water.  The people working in the fields glower at you, clearly wanting you to get out of their fields before you destroy the delicate plants.  You have reached the edge of the rice fields.  Beyond this, you see barren, impassable ground, ending at the mountain itself, which rises all around the city.

East.description: The fields stretch to the east, ending at a road.

South.description: The fields end at a high stone wall.

rooms.name: The Revolving Stage
rooms.description: Wooden steps, sturdy but plain, descend from a gigantic disk-shaped cutout in the stage floor above. Below it a crosspost extends from the center of the disk to the packed-earth floor, showing signs of wear along its base that indicate it's been rotated often. The disk itself has eight smaller posts going down from the circle to within three feet of the ground. The underground passage extends southward, but the only exit lies upstairs.

South.description: The dust tickles your nose, and south is dark and not very safe-seeming.

Up.description: You look up and see the outline of a circular hole in the ceiling.

extras.text: The post in a thick as a grown man, and supports the twenty-foot circle above. Smaller beams extend down from it. You can see how, if you push against the smaller beams, the stage would revolve in a circle.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: You look around, and feel your boots sliding in muck and mud.  Rice fields are apparently pretty wet animals!  You can head for the threshing hut to the west, more rice fields to the north and south, or back to the road to the east.

North.description: The fields extend far to the north. Beyond them, you can see a shining palace of some kind.

East.description: You see a road running north-south, and beyond that, green fields.

South.description: The fields extend to the south, ending some distance away at a high stone wall.

West.description: You see a bamboo hut to the west.

rooms.name: The Threshing House
rooms.description: The bamboo hut here stands almost as a reminder.  Beside it are various tools of the thresher's trade.  You stand under the thatched roof, wiping your brow - you had no idea how hot it would be, with the sun reflecting off the water in the fields!

North.description: The fields run far to the north.

East.description: The fields run as far as your eye can see, interrupted by a road a bit to the east.

South.description: The fields run a short distance to the south, ending at a high stone wall.

rooms.name: The Jiutai-za (Chorus Chamber)
rooms.description: This small chamber is devoid of all decoration. Its wooden floor and walls are utterly bare, though whitewashed and very clean. Woven straw mats are arranged neatly in the room in two lines. The way the walls are angled make every sound echo and re-echo. An archway leads north.

North.description: The noise of your footsteps echoes to the north, where the stage is.

rooms.name: The Trap-Lift
rooms.description: A wooden staircase leads down from a platform suspended by all kinds of pulleys and lever arrangements. A panel at the staircase's top allows passage through the platform. The ground itself is flattened, packed earth with a faint scent of wood and dirt. A lamp keeps the area lit, but it's very dim. The only visible exit is the one leading through the platform.

North.description: The quietude coming from the north unnerves you completely.

Up.description: Above you, trapdoor's operation seems very simple. You might be able to use the winch nearby to get out.

extras.text: The winch has ropes and pulleys connecting the lift to an elaborate wooden framed elevator. The frame goes all the way up to the ceiling.
The frame is made of wood and seems very sturdy.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: The rice is a tender shade of green, almost light green, and you can breathe in the humidity of the air here.  The water reflects the sunshine above.  You can go back to the road to the east, or go north, south, or west to more fields.

North.description: The fields run a ways to the north, ending at a road, and beyond that, an elegant palace of some kind.

East.description: You see a paved road, with lush green rice fields beyond that.

South.description: The fields run far to the south, ending at the city wall.

West.description: The fields end to the west at a tall wooden fence. You hear laughter coming from behind it.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: In places the sun reflects off the water, glinting like diamonds among the lush green of the rice plants.  Your attention is drawn to a tall fence to the west, obscuring an open air structure of some kind.  There doesn't seem to be any way over the fence though.

North.description: The fields continue to the north.

East.description: The fields continue to the east.

South.description: You see a bamboo hut to the south.

extras.text: It's well made, of freshly cut and cured wooden planks nailed tightly together. You can't see what's beyond the wall, but you can see that a building rises above it -- an outdoor stage.

rooms.name: Emperor's Pavilion
rooms.description: This part of the theatre is richly appointed with black and white fusara paintings of landscapes and embroidered cushions for kneeling.  An audience box with an intricate cross-branch design seems designed to allow someone inside to see outside without anyone being able to see his or her identity. Some of the "branches" of the blind are pushed open wider with bits of paper for better visibility. Archways lead north to another pavilion, or west toward the stage itself.

North.description: You hear the hearty shouts of the samurai to the north.

West.description: The huge stage starts to the west of here.

extras.text: While some societies would consider a formal painting one that is very colourful and expressive, Odaishyozen denizens consider colour far too frivolous to use in formal situations. None of the paintings depicts a human person, and none are very detailed -- in fact, most of them seem to consist of only a few black brush-strokes upon white rice paper.

rooms.name: Stage Right
rooms.description: This is one side of a large wooden stage. It is currently bare of props or backgrounds, revealing the theatre's back wall. A chorus chamber can be seen to the south, really just a bank where people can stand to sing, while an opulent pavilion lies just east of here. The stage extends to the north. A square shape is cut into the stage itself. The area smells a bit of wood and human sweat.

North.description: The huge stage continues to the north here.

East.description: An elegant pavilion stands to the east. Far to the east you see a high wooden fence.

South.description: A very small room opens to the south.

Down.description: You see a trapdoor set into the floor, secured by an iron ring.

rooms.name: The Geza (Orchestra Room Annex)
rooms.description: The drum set should have given you a clue of what this room's function is, or could it be the flutes and pipes hung on the wall on a rack?  At any rate, you imagine the music here is loud, raucous, and very popular.  From here, you can only go north.

North.description: Passage north is obstructed by a plain wooden door with a loose handle.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: Rice fields never change much, you notice.  There's just something primordial about a rice paddy.  This one is well kept, with rows of tender shoots flashing green against the startling blue of the sky.  You can go north, south, or west, or east back to the road.

North.description: The fields extend to the north.

East.description: A well-kept road interrupts the fertile green fields to the east.

South.description: The fields stretch as far south as your eye can see.

West.description: The fields end to the west at a wooden fence.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: The rice plants sway in the wind, and you have to clog your way through the mud and muck and water.  Your attention is drawn to a tall fence to the west, obscuring an open-air structure of some kind.  You do not see any way through the fence, although there are scuffles on the ground.

North.description: A pond stands to the north, with a tall oak tree beside it.

East.description: The fields go a short way to the east, ending at a road with more fields beyond it.

South.description: The fields go far to the south. You see a hut not far away.

extras.text: You see footprints in the dirt near the fence. One set of prints is small, and the other set is much larger. You wonder whose they are. And is that a strand of long, dark hair you see on the ground?

rooms.name: Nobles' Pavilion
rooms.description: Several benches are arranged in a semi-circle facing the main stage area of the theatre. The ground is quite clean, with a thrown carpet to make footing more comfortable, and fine silk paintings hang on the wooden walls. Serene and finely-appointed, the whole pavilion all but reeks of nobility. A fence walls in the back of the pavilion, though one board of it looks newer than the others.

East.description: As you go to the fence, you are suddenly able to see how it is different. Behind the ornately carved pavilion, you see a patch of fence that somehow seems worn with use. That's impossible, you think: Who would handle one board in a fence only?

West.description: A noisy pavilion to the west arrests your attention.

extras.text: Wooden planks make up the whitewashed fence, all tightly fitted and sanded smooth as silk or glass. The whitewashing on one board is a little more worn away than the other boards.

rooms.name: Samurai Pavilion
rooms.description: This roofed pavilion is dark-painted wood with a peaked tile cover. It affords a good view of the theatre's performance stage. Its benches are of plain wood with a lot of sword-cuts in their surfaces, while the ground has occasional dark reddish-brown stains scattered across it. Utilitarian but comfortable, the pavilion gives warriors a good place to watch performances. Other pavilions, far more lavish, can be seen to the east and south, while the theatre's foyer lies northward.

North.description: You see the theatre's foyer.

East.description: A beautifully decorated pavilion stands to the east. Beyond that, you see a high wooden fence.

South.description: The theatre continues to the south. You see paintings on the light stained fence, cushions on the ground, and a wooden blind of some kind.

rooms.name: Stage Left
rooms.description: This part of the stage is wide and devoid of props. Its surface is made of tightly-fitted boards sanded smooth as silk and finished with a lacquered clear gloss. The sound quality here is quite good, with any noises echoing across the stage and out to the audience areas, which lie to the sides and front of the stage. A door set in the rear wall is painted with a golden oak tree, opening to another room to the west. The stage extends to the south.

South.description: A large wooden stage extends to the south.

West.description: A hallway leads off to a small room to the west.

Down.description: Is that the outline of a round disk in the ground? You circle it.. and you finally see a ring set into the middle of the circle.

rooms.name: Mirror Room
rooms.description: Not named for literal mirrors, this room is a place where the actors in the plays give themselves one last moment of mental preparation through reflecting on the self before heading out for the stage, enveloped in an aura of peace. You can sit down on one of the cushions, or perhaps you would rather contemplate the ikebana flower arrangement in the corner? You can go east, to Stage Left, or west, to the dressing rooms.

East.description: Eastward, the stage continues.

South.description: The other side of the door is plain, almost laughably so, with a loose doorknob.

West.description: You think you see people in the room to the west... but they're not moving?

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: The tall green rice plants don't quite hide the water flooding the field. In places the sun reflects off the water, glinting like diamonds among the lush green of the rice plants.  The people working in the fields glower at you, clearly wanting you to get out of their fields before you destroy the delicate plants.  You can see, far to the north, processions of people going west in fancy carriages.

North.description: You see the northeast corner of the rice fields, ending at the intersection of two roads.

East.description: You see a road, and beyond it, lush green fields.

South.description: The fields go as far to the south as your eye can see.

West.description: To the west you see a peaceful pond with a tree standing near it.

rooms.name: The Seeding Pond
rooms.description: How strange!  You come upon a large, circular pond with a tall tree overhanging it.  Suspended from the tree's branches are ropes that go all the way into the water.  You pull experimentally on one rope and pull up a sodden bale of long rice-grass with shoots of baby rice plants sticking out of it. You look around, unable to figure out what this is all about.

North.description: The fields end to the north, bounded by a road. Beyond the road, you see an elegant palace.

East.description: The fields extend to the east. Beyond that, you see a road.

South.description: The fields extend to the south as far as your eye can see.

West.description: Westward, the fields end at a tall wooden fence. You hear voices coming from behind it.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: This little corner of the rice fields is bounded to the west and south by a tall fence to the west.  The fence has a knothole in it, letting you see what's behind it.  From the beaten-down grass here, you gather that you're not the first to notice this knothole.

North.description: You see the northwest corner of the lush green rice fields.

East.description: To the east you see a quiet, peaceful pond and a many-branched oak tree.

extras.text: Through the knothole you see people in beautiful, flowing robes coming down a walk lined with mosaic-shells, laughing and talking among themselves. You wonder where they're going.

rooms.name: The Theatre's Foyer
rooms.description: Fences form an outdoor path whose floor is inlaid with shimmering seashells. Ornately carved stone lanterns stand at regular intervals along the pathway. To the south, a monumental structure made of stone, with no roof, stands. Benches and cushions are arranged before what is clearly a stage.  Pavilions stand to the south.

North.description: More chattering is coming from the north.

South.description: You see lumbering men in huge robes and armor bustling to the south.

rooms.name: Dressing Room
rooms.description: Deep, double-doored closets line the far wall.  You note the hooks in the walls and ceiling, and the occasional costume, bright with embroidery, hanging from one.  Mannequin heads, some with wigs on them, some without, stand questioning on a long shelf against the northern wall.  Pots of makeup, white and black and red and green and gold, rest below the wigs.  You see an adjoining room to the south, or you can go east to the mirror room.

East.description: To the east, you think you see people!

South.description: To the south, you see only darkness.

rooms.name: Costume Room
rooms.description: This small room is stuffed full of racks and trunks and shelves that contain a prodigious amount of clothing.  Props, from swords to masks to fake beards, spill out of boxes.  The scent of dust is strong, though the room appears quite clean.  The only exit stands to the north.

North.description: You think you can get out to the north, where you see another small, dim room.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: This corner of the field is clean and well-kept, possibly because of its high visibility!  On the north you can reach Kitayama Way, on the east, Sumisara Road.  People passing by on foot or in people-drawn carriages stare at you without any sense of impropriety, obviously wondering who you are and where you came from.  You can see two beautiful palaces just north of here -- one just to the west, one a little to the northeast -- and you can hear the happy babbling of a bazaar to the north.

North.description: Kitayama Row continues to the north. Beyond it, you see a noisy bazaar and an elegant palace.

East.description: Sumisara Way runs just east of here. Beyond that, you can see more rice fields.

South.description: The rice fields extend as far south as your eye can see.

West.description: The fields continue to the west for quite a ways.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: You stand in the muck and breathe the life-drenched air deeply.  It's actually pretty peaceful here, with the birds wheeling across the sky and the insects buzzing in your ears.  To the north, you can reach Kitayama Way, and beyond that, a dazzling wall rises, obscuring something beyond your sight.  Or you can head east, west, or south to the fields.

North.description: Directly to the north you see Kitayama Row -- and beyond that, a beautiful palace gate.

East.description: You see the fields to the east, bounded by an intersection.

South.description: To the south you see a small, peaceful pond, with a many-branched oak tree gracefully leaning over it.

West.description: To the west you see where the fields end, bounded by a wooden fence.

rooms.name: Rice Fields
rooms.description: This corner of the field is bounded by Kitayama Way to the north and by a tall fence to the west.  You can't see over the fence, but from the sounds of it, someone is having a lot of fun on the other side of it!

North.description: To the north you see a paved road. Beyond that, you see a palace.

East.description: To the east you see the lush, fertile rice fields.

South.description: The rice fields end here in a neatly-cut corner.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Theatre
